definition: to be evenly matched/to meet one's match
chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: When a general meets a worthy opponent, he won't dare to underestimate him.
sentences.chinese: 棋逢對手難相勝，將遇良才不敢驕。

sentences.english: The ball match this afternoon must be fantastic for diamond cut diamond.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午的球賽棋逢對手，一定很精彩。

sentences.english: The afternoon match is a diamond cut diamond, it must be wonderful.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午的球賽棋逢對手，一定很精彩。

sentences.english: The runners were a good match and ran a very close race.
sentences.chinese: 賽跑選手們棋逢對手，比賽非常激烈。

sentences.english: The well-matched tennis players fought a long, close battle.
sentences.chinese: 兩名棋逢對手的網球選手打了一場勢均力敵的長仗。

definition: in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
wedding night
Six Records of a Floating Life, autobiographical novel and description of Qing dynasty life by 沈復|沈复[Shen3 Fu4], published 1808
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
true sentiments are seen in hard times (idiom)/you see who your true friends are when you go through tough times together/you see who your true friends are when you are in difficulties
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
skin-deep/superficial/shallow
protective coloration/camouflage
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
Zhang Ruoxu (c. 660-720), Tang dynasty poet, author of yuefu poem River on a spring night 春江花月夜
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
alchemy
